    Author:
    Jeroen Meijer

    • Method Detail

      • verifyFormula

        protected void verifyFormula(String formula)
        Description copied from class: AbstractLTSmin
        This method must verify that the given formula adheres to the expected syntax of the chosen serialization format for hypotheses of this model-checker.

        If the formula does not adhere to the expected syntax, this method should throw a IllegalArgumentException, possibly containing nested causes that further elaborate on why the formula couldn't be verified.

        Specified by:
        verifyFormula in class AbstractLTSmin<I,DFA<?,I>,Lasso.DFALasso<I>>
        Parameters:
        formula - the formula to verify

      • findCounterExample

        public @Nullable Lasso.DFALasso<I> findCounterExample(DFA<?,I> automaton,
                                                      Collection<? extends I> inputs,
                                                      String property)
        Converts the FSM file to a Lasso.DFALasso.
        Specified by:
        findCounterExample in interface ModelChecker<I,DFA<?,I>,String,Lasso.DFALasso<I>>
        Parameters:
        automaton - the DFA used to compute the number of loop unrolls.
        inputs - the alphabet.
        property - the property.
        Returns:
        the counter examples, or null if no counter examples exist.
        See Also:
        ModelChecker.findCounterExample(Object, Collection, Object)
